channel.title: Comments on: To-Do in Alex Land 2009
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.description: Perhaps another resolution ought to be "start testing my website in ie6". On second thought, the hell with ie6 ;)
item.content:encoded: Perhaps another resolution ought to be “start testing my website in ie6”. On second thought, the hell with ie6 ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.content:encoded:
It acts how you’d expect now.

It might just have been IE6 – that’s all I have access to at work, and I’ve never
looked at your page from FF or IE7.

item.title: By: Alex Ullrich
item.dc:creator: Alex Ullrich
item.content:encoded:
Thanks traingamer, I never noticed the “jump” before. Is it an IE6 issue? (I made the change and I don’t see any difference). I’m kind of upset about the contact thing, I’ll have to see if they changed something on me.

Denis, crummy 2.0 sounds much better ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: traingamer
item.dc:creator: traingamer
item.content:encoded:
Speaking of your crummy web page, I tried sending an email from the ‘Contact me’ page, but it errored out. To keep your page from having the annoying IE ‘jump’ when you hover on your links, change the css from:
UL.navbar LI {
BORDER-RIGHT: #000011 …
to:
UL.navbar LI a {
BORDER-RIGHT: #000011 …

It’s one of the wonderful IE box model vagaries.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
>>Crummy Web Page Rewrite

Maybe you could call it LessThanCrummy?
